title: Major version appended to project name in inconsistent pattern

content.raw:
We have been appending the major version number of a package to its project name for the ignition packages for a little while now. It's not always part of the debian metadata though.

New packages with major version 0 often don't have the 0 in the debian metadata (for example [ignition-cmake](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake-release/src/b7e55f502966b99d5f033b3685d34517eb00afd0/xenial/debian/changelog?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default)), but once they reach version 2, it is added (for example [ignition-transport2](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport2-release/src/8d4c1413e2bcbbd41c390dd73d9a729458651233/xenial/debian/changelog?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) and [ignition-math4](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math4-release/src/c01af0b1d89c1751bf004ae403971502f2c4ec2c/xenial/debian/changelog?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default).

The reason I bring this up now is that I just tried to make a prerelease of ignition-math4 and noticed that its tarball doesn't have the extra major version (ie `ignition-math-4.0.0~pre2.tar.bz2`). This causes the `release.py` script to fail since it expects a tarball named `ignition-math4-4.0.0~pre2.tar.bz2`.

We have been appending the major version number of a package to its project name for the ignition packages for a little while now. It's not always part of the debian metadata though.

New packages with major version 0 often don't have the 0 in the debian metadata (for example ignition-cmake), but once they reach version 2, it is added (for example ignition-transport2 and ignition-math4.

The reason I bring this up now is that I just tried to make a prerelease of ignition-math4 and noticed that its tarball doesn't have the extra major version (ie ignition-math-4.0.0~pre2.tar.bz2). This causes the release.py script to fail since it expects a tarball named ignition-math4-4.0.0~pre2.tar.bz2.
